result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerome Canady was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
12-23-15/ Judge John Siefert
The Court granted the defendant's request for release privileges for the following:  Electronic Monitoring
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served. No Huber privileges. Court stayed the commencment until 12-30-15. If defendant pays the fine in this case and municipal case in Glendale, court will allow sentence to be served on ES.
Court ordered a fine in the amount of $1000.00 including  all mandatory costs, fees and DNA surcharges to be paid by 12-30-15 or serve 20 consecutive days in the House of Correction.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerome Canady

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reflects 12-23-15 Court order granting release for  EM
Court signed order allowing the defendant release privileges and can be served on electonic monitoring. Copies forwarded to the parties. lr
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. jbs
Letter from defense counsel seeking release on ES based on payment of financial obligations.

Defendant Jerome Canady in court with attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 10 days  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  No Huber privileges.  court stayed the commencment until 12-30-15. If defendant pays the fine in this case and municipal case in glendale, court will allow sentence to be served on ES. 

Court ordered a fine in the amount of $1000.00 including  all mandatory costs,fees and dna surcharges  to be paid by 12-30-15 or serve 20 consecutive days in the House of Correction.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Jerome Canady in court with attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Pre-trial conference.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jerome Canady in court with attorney Benjamin Wallis Lutgen.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  OCCR Tape #15-171
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 9/3/15 @ 1:30 pm
